448923.title: Strategic Relationships Lead - 150th Celebrations Project
448923.description:
The Organisation

For over 100 years The Leprosy Mission Australia has partnered with Australians to ensure that people affected by leprosy across the world get the cure, care, and restoration they need to live life in all its fullness. As part of a global network comprised of 30 Members and Affiliates, we are working together to reach their goal of zero Leprosy transmission by 2035.

In 2024, The Leprosy Mission as an international organisation will be celebrating 150 years of bringing healing and dignity to people who have been affected by leprosy.

The Leprosy Mission is an organisation driven by Christian values to extend the hand of ‘mateship’ to those affected by Leprosy, disability and other marginalised people. Our programs are on the ground in India, Nepal, Nigeria, Indonesia, and Timor Leste.

The Role – Strategic Relationships

Reporting to the CEO you will take ownership of the existing Major Gifts portfolio with a clear focus on growing each of your assigned revenue streams; Major Gifts (High net worth donors), Corporations, Trusts & Foundations (Family & Corporate) and Grants.

As Strategic Relationships Lead you will be a self-driven relationship manager with the ability to build a robust fundraising pipeline and have the resilience and patience to see this through. You will provide a high level of donor engagement techniques including phone calls, face to face meetings, online meetings, strategic digital and offline communications, and an array of events.

You will research, identify, establish and nurture relationships with your prospects and existing portfolio to grow support for the work and mission of the organisation and play a vital role in the organisation's continued success.

150th Celebrations Lead

Working closely with the CEO and the Fundraising & Communications Manager you will take the lead to develop, promote and execute a range of activities that celebrate the 150 years of The Leprosy Mission in 2024, including fundraising events, campaigns, and product offerings that increase awareness of The Leprosy Mission Australia.

The role has the full support of the CEO and Board, a recent wealth scan has been completed, impact and case for support reports are in place and there is internal team support and resources available to really make this a success. If you want to be a part of a legacy that says ‘goodbye’ to Leprosy then this could be the role for you.

Responsibilities

  • Develop the Philanthropy strategy in collaboration with the Fundraising & Communications Manager & CEO
  • Identify, engage & solicit major gift & foundations prospects
  • Develop & implement a tailored communication strategy for your pipeline
  • Engage existing donors & cultivate effective, long-term relationships through a variety of communication channels
  • Produce monthly reports for measurable fundraising activities in your program
  • Further develop the strategy for the mid-level donor journey and upgrade
  • Prepare donor briefings for larger asks to support the CEO
  • Effective ask, negotiation and close for prospect donors including stewardship & reporting
  • Assist with the creation of philanthropy related events
  • Represent the organisation on occasion in group settings including public speaking
  • Contributing to the partnerships, events and fundraising aspects of the emerging strategic plan for the 150th celebrations ensuring the core purpose of TLMA remains central to all activities
  • Work with the Social Enterprise team to promote a product range that promotes brand awareness of the celebrations

Your Skills & Attributes

  • Respectful & comfortable operating in a Christian belief-based organisation
  • Demonstrated success in a relationship fundraising role is preferred
  • Success in a business development position with a long sales cycles & long-term relationships - plus a clear connection to their mission or beliefs will be considered.
  • Confidence with CRM system usage; inputting information & reporting
  • Excellent interpersonal skills & the ability to connect & influence a large group of people
  • Experience building & maintaining long term, meaningful, professional relationships.
  • Clear persuasive communication skills, both spoken & written
  • Excellent information presentation skills
  • A commitment to best practice fundraising, engagement & customer service
  • Results-oriented with the ability to take initiative & be proactive

Please note that TLMA has a zero-tolerance policy towards any abuse, neglect, and exploitation to all people. Safeguarding is everyone's responsibility, and all employees are required to act in such a way that always safeguards the health and wellbeing of children and vulnerable adults.

All TLM staff are required to participate in mandatory safeguarding training.

The successful candidate will be required to clear a National Police Check.

A position description is attached.
448923.summary: Increase Strategic Relationships and income across major gifts, and T&F. Project lead for the 150th Celebrations of The Leprosy Mission. Working to defeat leprosy & transform lives across the world.
448923.application: If you would like to apply for this role submit an up-to-date resume. If you do not have fundraising experience, please also include a cover letter outlining your experience with high-net-worth individuals or long sales cycles and your reason for applying.

448829.title: Director Operations
448829.description:
Use your expertise to drive impact and support client outcomes for vulnerable people!

WHAT WE CAN OFFER

  • Permanent full-time position
  • Generous salary packaging
  • Additional paid leave – up to 10 days inclusive of public holidays over the Christmas/New Year period
  • Flexible work arrangements considered

ABOUT US

Circle Green Community Legal (Circle Green) is a not-for-profit community legal centre providing state-wide specialist legal services in employment, workplace discrimination, residential tenancy law, family and domestic violence, and humanitarian services.

Our Purpose is to create a system, place, and space to ensure a safety net of best practice legal advice, education, and advocacy in our specialist fields.

OUR VALUES

Fair and equitable - We are committed to creating access to legal advice, education and advocacy so human and social rights can be upheld.

Holistic - We deliver wraparound support that addresses people’s needs to enable access to justice.

Collaborate for change - We are stronger together. We collaborate with our clients, staff, partners, and government. We welcome partners who create better access to justice and permanent solutions.

Regenerate - We create a support system for each other so we can create a better world.

ABOUT THE ROLE

The Director Operations works as part of the Executive Leadership Team to deliver the strategic plan. The role is responsible for providing leadership, management and oversight of corporate services including marketing and communications, office administration, financial management, facilities, contract management and reporting, people and culture, and technology.

Reporting directly to the Chief Executive Officer and working closely with the Leadership Team, this role will develop strategies and deliver internal services and systems that support service delivery.

The Director Operations also manages relationships with key stakeholders and supports opportunities for internal collaboration with a focus on client outcomes and holistic service delivery.

Leading a small but high performing team, your responsibilities will include:

  • Participation and contribution to the Executive Leadership Group, including participation in strategic planning, risk management and reporting to Board and funders.
  • Supporting, guiding, and cultivating an environment of continuous improvement, best practice, and innovation.
  • Ensuring effective and efficient functioning of the day-to-day operations of the organisation.
  • Maintaining development and systematic review of policies in line with best practice and national accreditation standards.
  • Overseeing people and culture, marketing, and communications functions.
  • Management of the organisation’s physical infrastructure, physical assets, and office maintenance.
  • Overseeing and ensuring effective financial management of the organisation.
  • Management and development of information technology and data systems.
  • Overseeing data integrity and the collection and analysis of data to provide an evidence base for funding opportunities.
  • Contract management and compliance
  • In collaboration with leadership team, identify opportunities to attract further funding which support activities that reflect strategic focus areas and values of organisation.

ABOUT YOU

We are seeking an individual with experience leading a diverse team and delivering outcomes in a complex and fast paced environment. Experience or understanding of community legal centres/ community-based organisations is beneficial.

Shortlisted candidates will have:

  • Relevant qualifications in accounting, human resources, and/or management with minimum 3 years in a similar position.
  • Be excellent in strategic and operational planning, management of finance, accounting, budgetary control, and reporting.
  • Experience in managing people and culture.
  • Experience in grant application and acquittal procedures.
  • Well-developed verbal, written communication and negotiating skills.
  • Proven relationship building skills and project management experience.
  • Understanding and sensitivity to people from diverse cultural, socio economic and linguistic backgrounds.
  • Demonstrated commitment to human rights and social justice issues.

This is an exciting opportunity to drive impact of a specialist community legal centre! Competitive salary to be negotiated.

If you have any questions or would like to have a confidential discussion about the role, please contact Human Resources at (08) 6148 3648 or by email to hr@circlegreen.org.au using the subject line: Director Operations enquiry via EthicalJobs.

Due to high number of applications received, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Thank you for your interest to work at Circle Green.

Circle Green is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace that values and supports all individuals. We encourage applications from diverse backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from Culturally and Linguistically Diverse backgrounds, people from the LGBTIQA+ community, and people with disabilities.

For a full list of the position description and selection criteria, please view the position description attached.
448829.summary: Join a specialist community legal centre to provide leadership, management and oversight of corporate services functions. Use your expertise to support client outcomes for vulnerable people!
448829.application: To apply, submit your CV and a Cover Letter addressing the selection criteria.

448851.title: Counsellor / Advocate Child & Family - Morwell
448851.description:
Join Our Team at Gippsland Centre Against Sexual Assault

Are you ready to make a real difference in the lives of those who need it most?

Gippsland CASA is looking for a passionate individual to join our family of caring professionals.

We value respect, empowerment, dignity and integrity, and we're excited to welcome new team members who share our commitment to these ideals.

At Gippsland CASA, we believe in the power of a diverse and compassionate workforce. We provide a safe and welcoming space for all, where every voice is heard, valued, and respected.

If you would like a change to the countryside, we can offer a relocation allowance, professional development and salary sacrificing.

Counsellor / Advocate – Child and Family

Position number 20036.

As a Counsellor/Advocate at Gippsland CASA, you will provide trauma-informed counselling and advocacy to survivors of sexual assault, collaborate with a diverse team to create an inclusive and welcoming atmosphere, advocate for clients' best interests within the service system and maintain accurate and confidential records while upholding the highest ethical standards.

About Us:

Gippsland Centre Against Sexual Assault (GCASA) is funded by the Department of Families, Fairness and Housing, Victoria. GCASA is an Incorporated Association, governed by a community-based Board and is funded to provide comprehensive sexual assault support services and sexually abusive treatment services across the Gippsland Region. Our mission is to support survivors of sexual assault, empower individuals, and foster healing in our community.

Why Choose Gippsland CASA?:

  • Celebrate Diversity: We are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment where your unique perspective and experiences are appreciated.
  • Passion for Change: Join a team of like-minded individuals who are passionate about making a positive impact in the lives of survivors.
  • Empowering You: We believe that your well-being is the key to your success. Our commitment to your personal growth and self-care will help you thrive both professionally and personally.
  • Ongoing Learning: Be a part of an organisation that values continuous learning and professional development. We're committed to supporting your growth.
  • Giving Back Together: At Gippsland CASA, we know the importance of giving back to the community. Join us in our outreach and community engagement activities as we work together to make a positive impact beyond our counselling rooms.

Mandatory Qualifications:

  • A degree or equivalent certification in social welfare, counselling, social work, psychology, or related fields.
  • At least 2 years of counselling experience.
  • Strong clinical and communication skills.
  • An understanding of diversity, inclusion, and a commitment to respecting all clients.

A copy of the Position Description including the Key Selection Criteria is available online here or send an email request to hr@gippscasa.org using the subject line: Counsellor / Advocate Child & Family enquiry via EthicalJobs.

The successful applicant will:

  • Be willing if required to travel across the region and to Melbourne as negotiated for training and development.
  • Hold a current Victorian driver’s licence.
  • Hold a current Working with Children’s check.
  • Provide a current National Crim Check

Classification: Health and Professional Services Award

Position Fraction: Full time

Location: Based in the Multidisciplinary Centre Morwell

The successful applicant will be appointed for a six-month probationary period during which time, regular clinical and line management supervision is provided. At the conclusion of this period a performance review will be held with the CEO and Clinical Manager; after which, a decision will be made to offer ongoing employment or to cease employment with the Agency. 

APPLICATION INFORMATION

All applications must include a current resume with 3 referees names and contact details, an application letter and must address the key selection criteria.

If you have any further queries regarding this position, please contact:

Kate Neocleous

Clinical Manager

PH: 5134 3922

GCASA is culturally inclusive and welcomes applications from diverse cultures including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and or from the LGBTQIA+ Community.

448838.title: Disability Care Coordinator and Account Manager
448838.description:
• Location: Melbourne/Victoria 
  • Position Type: Full-Time
  • Schedule 1: 9am to 5pm Monday to Friday (38 hours a week) 
  • Schedule 2: Two weeks in a month maximum Standby On-Call Support (be standby on phone support after business hours and weekend).
  • Place of work: Sendayo Head-Offices - At the Waterman Business Centre (with a possibility to work from home). If on call stand-by, then the location is not limited to the head office.
  • Report to: Sendayo Directors or Lead Care Coordinator

Primary Role:

The Disability Care Coordinator and Account Manager will serve as the primary point of contact for staff, participants, and related stakeholders. This individual will handle administrative tasks, staff onboarding, participant onboarding, ongoing management, and ensure all procedures and documentation are up to date and in line with organisational policies and regulations.

Key Responsibilities:

Phone/Email/Receptionist/Admin Role:

  • Manage document uploads to Google Drive and allocate emails to the appropriate personnel.
  • Respond to emails or delegate to the respective department.
  • Answer phone calls during business hours.

Ongoing Participant Management:

  • Handle shift rosters, staff feedback, and training needs.
  • Communicate with all stakeholders related to the participant.
  • Ensure all compliance documents and plans are current and in accordance with the latest information.
  • Address and monitor complaints, feedback, and related communications 

Ongoing Staff Management:

  • Ensure document accuracy and handle staff training requirements.
  • Conduct yearly reviews of staff and maintain legal responsibilities.
  • Monitor work safe rules compliance and identify talent within the organisation.

After Hours Service:

  • Be rostered in to perform on-call duties for emergencies or urgent matters.  A standby pay will be paid at the fortnight the pay run is scheduled.

Additional Responsibilities:

Staff Onboarding - Recruitment:

  • Manage interview bookings and conduct them either in-person or via online meeting platforms.
  • Send requisite documents to successful candidates and inform unsuccessful ones.
  • Handle communication and documentation related to new hires.

Participant Onboarding - Intake Team:

  • Organise discussion meetings with prospective participants.
  • Extract care information from referral forms and match with appropriate staff.
  • Organise meet and greets for participants, ensuring a comprehensive checklist is covered.
  • Set up participants on the dashboard and ensure all details are in order.
  • Schedule shifts and manage staff trainings specific to participant needs.

Report to Authorised Program Officer (APO) Duties:

  • Oversee assessments, behaviour assessments, and individual planning.
  • Collaborate with all stakeholders to achieve the best outcomes for participants.
  • Report monthly to directors and handle documentation related to restrictive practices.
  • Organise and participate in relevant meetings and monitor medication and behaviour support plans.

Required Qualifications and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Disability, Social Work, Nursing, Psychology, Medical or a related field
  • Minimum of 2 years in the disability industry or similar roles 

Key Skills and Abilities:

  • Strong organisational and multitasking abilities.
  • Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Knowledge of NDIS guidelines and standards.
  • Demonstrated ability to work with diverse populations.
  • Attention to detail
  • Strong work ethic
  • Easy to work with
  • Kind hearted and understanding
  • Fluent English (writing and speaking)
  • Full Australian Working Rights

Compensation: 70K to 90K a year plus super

On Call Standby: $350 per week when on oncall duty (standby phone support) Monday to Sunday.
448838.summary: This position will handle administrative tasks, staff onboarding, participant onboarding, ongoing management, and ensure all procedures and documentation are up to date.

448772.title: Village Operations Manager
448772.description:
About the Role:

At Anglicare, we're committed to redefining senior living for the modern era. Our village is a place where residents thrive, and their well-being is our top priority. We're looking for a passionate and experienced Village Operations Manager to join our team and play a pivotal role in creating an exceptional living experience.

As the Village Operations Manager, you'll be at the heart of our village's success. You'll oversee a range of critical functions, ensuring that our residents enjoy the highest standards of living. Your role encompasses:

  • Hospitality Excellence - Bring your background in hotel management or a related field to elevate our dining and hospitality offerings. Create a warm, welcoming atmosphere where residents and guests savour every moment.
  • Site Maintenance and Presentation - Our village is a place of beauty and serenity. You'll manage site maintenance and landscaping, ensuring our surroundings are always pristine and inviting.
  • Vibrant Activities - Foster a dynamic community by curating engaging activities that cater to a range of interests. From art classes to outdoor adventures, you'll keep our residents active and fulfilled.
  • Community Engagement - Embrace our commitment to a caring Christian community. You'll play a key role in facilitating spiritual gatherings and community events that bring residents closer together.
  • Communication Expertise - Help us share our village's story and values effectively. Craft compelling messages that resonate with residents, families, and staff.
  • Commercial Operations - Strategically assess and optimise commercial operations within the village, including cafes and other retail outlets or events, to ensure they align with our mission and are financially sustainable.
  • Leadership - Lead a team of dedicated staff, inspiring them to deliver exceptional service and contribute positively to the village community.

About You:

To excel in this role, you'll bring:

  • A background in hotel management or a related field, ideally with experience in senior living or hospitality.
  • Exceptional leadership skills to motivate and mentor staff.
  • A values-based approach that aligns with our organisation's mission.
  • Financial acumen and experience in budgeting.
  • The ability to create a warm and inclusive environment.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Proficiency in office administration leadership.
  • A commitment to quality, safety, and community.

About Us:

For over 160 years Anglicare has been serving people in need- providing care to older people and services to the vulnerable. We began because of people like you, people who saw a need in the community and who were compelled to make a difference. People motivated by Christian love and a passion to serve..

To find out more please visit: anglicare.org.au.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants are encouraged to apply.

Anglicare - Jesus Christ honoured, lives enriched and communities strengthened.

Anglicare is committed to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of children and young people and has zero tolerance of child abuse.

Please be advised Anglicare does not accept unsolicited resumes. Anglicare will not recognise an introduction or placement fee unless the Agency has been briefed by a member of the Talent Acquisition team on a specific position for which we have requested candidates. Note we are not considering additions to our list of Panel Suppliers.
448772.summary: We're looking for a passionate and experienced Village Operations Manager to join our team and play a pivotal role in creating an exceptional living experience. Based at Taren Point.

448730.title: Care Operations Manager
448730.description:
At Anglicare, we're dedicated to redefining the way we approach senior living. Our community is a place where residents are cherished, and their well-being is paramount. We're seeking an exceptional Care Operations Manager to join our team and play a central role in ensuring the highest quality of care for our residents.

As the Care Operations Manager, you'll be the heartbeat of our community's care operations. Your role encompasses:

  • Resident-Centered Care - Your commitment to empathy and dignity will shine as you oversee and authorise care plans, ensuring residents receive the care that aligns with their well-being and individuality.
  • Clinical Excellence - Lead our care teams to achieve clinical benchmarks and exceed residents' physical health, clinical, and mobility needs. Uphold the highest standards of care in accordance with Anglicare policies and procedures.

  • Compliance and Safety - Ensure compliance with government funding regulations, including reporting and documentation. Uphold safety standards, infection control, workplace health, and quality practices.

  • Financial planning and budgeting experience.
  • A service-oriented mindset with a strong understanding of the needs of senior Australians.
  • Knowledge of relevant legislation and regulations.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, conflict resolution, and time management skills.
  • A commitment to quality, safety, and continuous improvement.

448702.title: Senior Manager - Community Truth Telling Pathways
448702.description:
Our organisation

Reconciliation Australia (RA) is an independent, national, not-for-profit organisation promoting and facilitating reconciliation by building relationships, respect and trust between the wider Australian community and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

Our vision is for a just, equitable and reconciled Australia.

Reconciliation Australia is developing Community Truth Telling Pathways (CTTP) that will advance a movement of truth-telling across Australia that is Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander led, place-based and strengths focused. It will provide a foundation of employing truth to advance justice and social and emotional wellbeing and ensure that the wrongs of the past are never repeated.

The CTTP aims to provide an understanding of the importance of learning about the shared histories and support the development of a nationwide culture of truth-telling by strengthening relationships between all Australians and supporting the health and wellbeing of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

The role

This position will lead and manage the Community Truth-telling Pathways, which includes strategic and operational direction, research and resource development, community engagement, and a grants program. Reporting to the General Manager of Policy, Research and Strategic Programs.

About you

Essential:

  • Identify and be recognised in the community as an Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander person.
  • Knowledge and appreciation of the cultural and social rights of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.
  • Understanding of and ability to work in a culturally responsive way with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and communities.
  • Ability to develop and maintain strong working relationships with a range of stakeholders including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and organisations, government, corporate and the not-for-profit sectors.
  • High level ability to develop and manage complex programs, including strategic direction, implementation of an effective program cycle, risk management processes, managing a large budget, financial acumen and reporting.
  • Project management and organisational skills including overseeing large events.
  • Proven experience to design and deliver effective community engagement, research and development, and grants administration strategies.
  • Extensive experience in leading, managing and developing high performing teams and ability to collaborate with cross-function teams.
  • Ability to take initiative, respond to complex environments and prioritise work over a range of projects to defined timeframes.
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills including the ability to communicate clearly and concisely to a range of audiences.
  • Strong experience in high level meeting facilitation and conflict management skills.
  • Commitment and willingness to learn about and contribute to reconciliation between Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and other Australians.
  • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience.

Desirable:

  • Experience in and/or an understanding of truth-telling in an Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander context

We are committed to improving employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and welcome applications from all Australians, especially those of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent as your cultural and lived experience is central to the work we do.

Applicants for this position should have valid working rights for Australia.

Salary and other details

The salary range for this role is $125,000 - $140,000 (Including 17.5% Leave Loading) + Superannuation, dependent on experience and qualifications.
448702.summary: Lead and manage the Community Truth-telling Pathways, which includes strategic and operational direction, research and resource development, community engagement, and a grants program.

448631.title: Specialist Family Violence Advisor in Mental Health - Geelong
448631.description:
• Opportunity to join an area mental health service to provide specialist family violence advice and build capacity in Barwon Health's Metal Health Drugs and Alcohol Service (MHDAS)
  • Barwon Health MHDAS is a large service which includes teams from acute, subacute, community and specialist services.
  • Full-time or Part-time will be considered.

About the facility

Barwon Health's Mental health, Drugs and Alcohol Services (MHDAS) provides integrated and recovery orientated mental health and drug and alcohol assessment, treatment, harm reduction and community and family support to people of all ages within the Barwon Region currently experiencing, or at risk of experiencing mental health and/or drug and alcohol issues. Our service is internationally recognised for its innovative clinical programs and integrated models of practice that are consumer centred, accessible and family inclusive. We are fortunate to enjoy excellent internal relationships and have developed excellent partnerships with local community that provide for seamless integrated care for our clients.

About the role

  • Provide family violence practice leadership
  • Support capacity building within MHDAS through providing specialist family violence expertise and advice in identifying, recognising and responding to family violence through an agreed shared care model
  • Support and strengthen networks and collaborations between services across relevant sectors
  • Enhance referral pathways that provide a more integrated and collaborative health and human service system response to family violence

About the culture

This role is in the newly created Quality Program stream of MHDAS, creating an exciting opportunity to focus on embedding quality improvement and research into family violence response in MHDAS. The Specialist Family Violence Advisor position sits alongside specialist roles of Forensic Clinical Specialist, Homeless Outreach Program (HOPS) and Families where a Parent has a Mental Illness (FaPMI).

Barwon Health staff benefits

  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Professional development
  • Access to employee wellness program
  • Salary packaging
  • Social club

Diversity and Inclusion

At Barwon Health we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce where we value each person’s uniqueness. We embrace diverse life experiences and the perspectives of our people, whilst providing high-quality health care to all members of our community, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, disability, or sexual orientation.

We are committed to providing positive employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and welcome employment applications from candidates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background. We also strongly encourage people with disability and diverse backgrounds to apply for our roles.

We are strongly committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people. Click here for further information on the Victorian Government’s Child Safe Standards: About Child Safe Standards | Victorian Government (www.vic.gov.au)

We are also proud to be Totally Smoke Free.

If we can assist you with any reasonable adjustments to submit your application for this role, please contact mentalhealth.recruitment@barwonhealth.org.au using the subject line: Specialist Family Violence Advisor in Mental Health - Geelong enquiry via EthicalJobs noting your preferred method of communication and contact details and a member of the team will be in touch.

This role must be fully vaccinated for Covid -19 and influenza and meet the requirements of the Barwon Health immunisation policy.

A position description is attached.
448631.summary: Seeking a Specialist Family Violence Adviser to provide family violence practice leadership and capacity building within Mental Health Drug Alcohol Service.

448605.title: Chief Executive Officer
448605.description:
Who are we looking for?

A decisive leader with strong understanding or lived experience of displacement and forced migration.

A person with insight into the changing operating, ethical and policy context for international NGO’s, particularly localisation and the shifting donor landscape.

A leader with the ability to drive transformational change through collaboration with the Board and sta, as well as international civil society coalitions, refugee advocates, and Australian partners.

A person with an ethical commitment to work towards the transfer of power to those most aected by displacement and forced migration.

A person with an imaginative business mindset, with the capacity to envision and deliver new modes of operation and collaboration that build on Act for Peace’s strengths and the latent talent and expertise of people aected by displacement.

Commitment to the underlying values and principles of Act for Peace and the National Council of Churches of Australia, with a vision to promote deeper direct engagement from churches and constituents in solidarity and concern.

Context

Act for Peace has embarked on an ambitious, Board-initiated process to envision a new mode of operation that equips the organisation to both full our vision and purpose and sets a foundation for ongoing nancial sustainability. A change process is already well underway to restore the budget to balance for FY25 and protect the organisation’s signicant reserves. An interim CEO is in place to support this process until March 2024. The Board has an “open mind” to future new ways of working and modes of operation and aims to have implemented fundamental changes in the operating context by December 2025.

Key Objectives to December 2025

Provide a visionary, purpose-driven and creative voice to the consultation process with the Board, sta and stakeholders as together we envision a new future (March - Dec 24).

  1. Provide sound advice to the Board on the changing policy and operating context, and emerging nancial and operational risks.
  2. Provide leadership and support to sta throughout the process, including fostering the collaborative, collegial team culture and re-positioning the CEO role into the new model.
  3. Work closely with the COO to manage the ongoing operations of AfP that meets the interests and obliga6ons of the organisation, supporters, institutional donors, and partner organisations.
  4. Support the transition of the organisation to a new business model as approved by the Board (Jan- Dec 25).

Safeguarding Requirements and Responsibilities

Act for Peace takes the prevention of fraud, sexual misconduct and harassment, and the protection of children seriously.

  • Employment is conditional upon the outcome of an Australian Police Background check, as well as an equivalent police background check for any country in which the applicant has lived for more than 12 months during the last five years and for each country of citizenship. A Working with Children Check is also required.
  • Strict adherence to our Code of Conduct, Child Safeguarding Policy, Child Safeguarding Code of Conduct, Prevention of Sexual Exploitation, Abuse and Harassment (PSEAH) Policy and the Privacy Policy is mandatory.

We recognise that people aected by displacement and forced migration may have experienced signicant disruption to their education and work life. We welcome applications from people who can articulate a clarity of purpose around the Act for Peace vision, can demonstrate the ability to lead transformational change, and can represent the organisation’s values with conviction.
448605.summary: Act for Peace is seeking to engage a new leader as part of an ambitious change process to position the organisation to best achieve our vision and purpose into the future.
448605.application:
Expressions of Interest should include either a cover letter or short recorded video outlining why you are a strong candidate, along with a CV of relevant experience for the role.

Please submit your Expressions of Interest to Margot Gallagher via the form below.

Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a preliminary discussion prior to a formal interview process with the Board recruitment panel.

448603.title: Head of Corporate Partnerships
448603.description:
• Parental Leave Cover

WHO ARE WE?

Lighthouse Foundation provides homes and therapeutic care programs to children and young people impacted by long-term neglect, abuse, and homelessness. Our focus is to create caring communities where kids can feel safe, form meaningful relationships, and begin to heal from traumatic experiences. For the past 30 years, our proven Model of Care has successfully transformed the lives of over 1,000 young people using a range of evidence-based strategies. We now educate and support Foster Carers in the same way, so that they too can take care of some of Australia’s most vulnerable children.

HOW WILL I HELP?

Building on a long history of diversified fundraising, Lighthouse Foundation's Corporate Partnerships team works diligently to achieve long-term, meaningful financial partnerships with value-aligned partners. In this high-performing, goals-oriented team, you will manage a passionate team focused on pitching, securing new partnerships, rolling out contract deliverables, seeking in-kind offerings to reduce expenses, tailoring activations/engagements, and fulfilling end to end partnership reporting.

As Head of Corporate Partnerships, you are responsible for leading strategy, securing, and stewarding long term and sustainable corporate partnerships for Lighthouse from a range of key networks.

Bringing your creative flare, events experience, and incredible relationship-building skills, you will increase the dollars coming through the door for the vital programs that Lighthouse runs. As leader of the Corporate Partnerships division your role is to build lasting relationships with business partners while keeping existing relationships fresh and fruitful. Ensuring support for the cause is continued in a long-term capacity, is key.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR ME?

Working for the Lighthouse Foundation means you will be working for an organisation that cares about the community. As Head of Corporate Partnerships, you will help support the organisation as it works with our homeless youth by engaging businesses and raising funds that support our life-changing programs. Your words will help save young lives and play a role in ending youth homelessness in Australia. Your role will provide impact to not only those within the Lighthouse Foundation but the countless others who use their services.

WHAT DO I NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL?

First and foremost, interpersonal skills are a must, with a level of maturity and understanding needed when working with those who use our services. Emotional intelligence and high-level relationship stewardship experience is required for this leadership role, both internally working across the organisation and externally representing the foundation at diverse levels (from CEOs to ground level volunteers).

From a professional standpoint you will require:

  • 5+ years demonstrated experience with new business development and achieving revenue targets
  • Solid experience working in fundraising, new business development and/or corporate partnerships
  • Ability to work independently on projects and as part of a team
  • Ability to plan, prioritise workloads, and meet deadlines as required
  • Demonstrated people management experience
  • Ability to think creatively to develop unique and mutually beneficial partnership proposals
  • Work/life experience with a track record of successful communication and measurable positive outcomes

Other key skills which would be beneficial:

  • Tertiary Qualification in related field
  • Exceptional attention to detail
  • Storytelling is a key part of engaging with our Corporate supporters, so communication skills in this area are highly valued.
  • An ability to manage multiple competing projects and their budgets

For this role you will please note you will also need:

  • Current driver’s licence
  • Criminal Records check
  • Current Working with Children check

APPLICATION PROCESS

We welcome your application and ask that you please review the attached position description, provide your Resume and Cover letter, broadly addressing the key selection criteria highlighted.

To submit your application, click Apply Now.

Lighthouse celebrates diversity and affirm the right of access, equity, and equality for every young person, staff member and volunteer in the Lighthouse Community. Our organisation is inclusive of all sexual orientations and gender identities. We also practice from a position of cultural safety and awareness, across diverse languages, religions, and cultures. we respect, respond and continue to learn about the unique needs of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander young people.

Lighthouse Foundation is a Child Safe Organisation, we are committed to a thoughtful and protective environment that supports our babies, children and young people to feel safe and respected, and to build their capacity to feel deeply cared for and important to other human beings.

Please find attached the position description.
448603.summary: Support the strategy, revenue and growth of Lighthouse Foundation's Partnerships portfolio through your incredible relationship skills, events experience and creativity.

448580.title: Youth Programs Coordinator
448580.description:
• Location: Flexible through remote working, office based in Collingwood, Victoria
  • Work type: Fixed-term (until June 2024), Full-time
  • Salary: SCHADS award level 5 plus generous salary packaging

CYDA is the national representative organisation for children and young people with disability aged 0 to 25 years. Our vision is that children and young people with disability living in Australia are valued and living empowered lives with equality of opportunity; and our purpose is to ensure governments, communities, and families, are empowering children and young people with disability to fully exercise their rights and aspirations.

Reporting to and working alongside the Youth Programs Manager, the Youth Programs Coordinator will be responsible for CYDA’s Rural Young Leaders Project – supporting regional/rural organisations across Australia to co-design and deliver a location-dependent version of CYDA’s National Young Leaders Program.

This role will work with the Youth Programs Manager and Youth Action Team to co-design and co-produce events and programs with young people with disability. This role will involve working with and alongside young people with disability, leading facilitations, project co-ordinating the delivery of events and projects, and creating outstanding opportunities for young people with disability to lead, to participate, to connect and to engage with their national organisation and peers.

This position requires exercising a degree of autonomy and initiative whilst operating under the general direction of the Youth Programs Manager.

We deeply value lived experience. People with a lived experience of disability or family connection with disability are strongly encouraged to apply.

For any further information please contact Daniel Munter on 0423 165 004 or danielmunter@cyda.org.au. If you have any accessibility enquiries please contact Laura Pettenuzzo on 0478 408 067 or laurapettenuzzo@cyda.org.au using the subject line: Youth Programs Coordinator enquiry via EthicalJobs.

A position description is attached.
448580.summary: Reporting to and working alongside the Youth Programs Manager, the Youth Programs Coordinator will be responsible for CYDAs Rural Young Leaders Project.
448580.application:

Applications should include:

  • a cover letter addressed to Daniel Munter, Youth Programs Manager
  • a statement addressing the selection criteria
  • your current CV / resume.
  • Applications provided in other formats due to access needs will be considered, please contact us to discuss this.

448598.description:
WHO ARE WE?

Lighthouse Foundation provides homes and therapeutic care programs to children and young people impacted by long-term neglect, abuse, and homelessness.

Our focus is to create caring communities where kids can feel safe, form meaningful relationships, and begin to heal from traumatic experiences. For the past 30 years, our proven Model of Care has successfully transformed the lives of over 1,000 young people using a range of evidence-based strategies.

We now educate and support Foster Carers in the same way, so that they too can take care of some of Australia’s most vulnerable children.

HOW WILL I HELP?

As Corporate Partnerships Coordinator your role is to build lasting relationships with business partners while keeping existing relationships fresh and fruitful. Working collaboratively and in a tight-knit group, you will be the go-to person for day-to-day and on-ground engagement activities with partners.

With a strategic focus, what is crucial is a positive ‘roll up your sleeve’s kind of attitude’ - one that makes our partners feel genuinely valued, excited and inspired to support our cause.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR ME?

Your words will help save young lives and play a role in ending youth homelessness in Australia. Your role will provide impact to not only those within the Lighthouse Foundation but the countless others who use their services.

We also practice from a position of cultural safety and awareness, across diverse languages, religions, and cultures. we respect, respond and continue to learn about the unique needs of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander young people.
