448598.summary: Support the strategy, revenue and growth of Lighthouse Foundation's Partnerships portfolio through your incredible relationship skills, events experience and creativity.

448541.title: Community Housing Property Director
448541.description:
• Highly regarded community NFP
  • Key leadership role – housing and tenant services
  • Salary $200K plus super, & attractive NFP salary packaging

The Organisation

Based in the Eastern suburbs (with working-from-home options), this wonderful organisation works in conjunction with other community organisations in the provision of housing support to people experiencing disadvantage.

The Position

Initially a six-month contract position (with a likelihood of extension, permanency, and even promotion), reporting to the Executive Director of the organisation, the Community Housing Property Director has oversight of all housing development projects and tenancy services to ensure quality service provision to tenants and stakeholders.

The role will focus on:

  • establishing processes and systems to support development projects
  • managing service delivery change, to achieve organisational and Government objectives
  • leading service growth, development, innovation, and enhancement in response to reforms and funding opportunities
  • providing key input to strategies to deliver a high level of service performance
  • leading initiatives that improve access to housing options, including community housing, private rental, affordable housing, and homelessness services

The Person

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • qualification in Social Housing, Social Science, Community Management, or related discipline
  • demonstrated Senior Management experience in property and tenancy management, including an understanding of the community and public housing sectors, and familiarity with relevant legislation
  • comprehensive understanding of operational service delivery, policy, and compliance requirements in the Community Housing sector
  • a values-based approach to service delivery through a demonstrated commitment to the principles of social justice, and person-centred and client-led service delivery

What’s on offer

The opportunity to create meaningful change and to contribute to the overall success of this community group. Offered initially as a six-month fixed-term contract, there is a high likelihood of extension, and a permanent role (with a promotion) for the right candidate.

On offer is an FTE salary of $200K plus superannuation. Attractive salary packaging benefits are also available.

If you have exceptional skills and are looking for a new and exciting challenge, please make an application by clicking the “Apply” tab below to submit your resume in Word format. To confidentially discuss this role further, please feel free to call Barry Vienet (0427 406 325) from Johnson Recruitment.

We are delighted to be managing another retained and exclusive assignment created in partnership and trust with our client.

Johnson Recruitment actively embraces diversity in the workforce through inclusive community representation of gender, culture, thought, and work arrangements.
448541.summary: Join this fantastic NFP community housing organisation, responsible for development & tenancy operations. Hybrid Eastern suburbs & WFH.

448455.title: 1800RESPECT Counsellors
448455.description:
• Multiple First Response Counsellor positions (full-time and part-time)
  • Work with a team that fosters an environment of collaboration and inclusivity
  • Work from the comfort of your home. IT equipment provided
  • We are a flexible workforce and will work with you on suitable shifts across our 24/7 roster to complement your lifestyle
  • Virtual paid training provided (Two Weeks: Monday – Friday, 9am – 5pm)
  • Coaching and supervision to complement your own resilience and self-care skills
  • Morning, Afternoon and Evening shifts available.

Make a lasting impact working for 1800RESPECT, the national front door for people seeking support for domestic, family and sexual violence in Australia.

Telstra Health is proud to work collaboratively with the Australian Government and specialist organisations to deliver 1800RESPECT, as the national front door for people affected by domestic, family and sexual violence and workplace sexual harassment.

Our purpose is to provide an accessible, high quality, clinically-informed and evidence-based service that meets the diverse needs and complex considerations of individuals seeking support.

Why join Telstra Health:

  • We have a flexible work environment so you can work from the comfort of your own home.
  • Embrace the freedom and flexibility to tailor your working hours to fit your personal needs and ambitions across our 24/7 roster.
  • Avenues for growth and stepping into other roles.
  • 30% discount on Telstra services including home broadband and post-paid mobiles.
  • Free 24/7 professional and confidential support for you and your family through EAP
  • Employee rewards program that includes discounts on shopping, gym memberships, movie tickets, health insurance and more
  • Multiple leave options including 16 weeks gender-equal paid parental, family and domestic violence leave, cultural, volunteer, study leave, as well as the option to purchase additional leave.

About the role:

We have a number of maximum term openings (through to June 2027) for First Response Counsellors(full-time and part time) who will provide telephone and online counselling and use their skills to assess the unique needs of individuals seeking support as part of the national 1800RESPECT service. As a First Response Counsellor, you will help achieve sustained reduction in the prevalence and impacts of domestic, family and sexual violence.

You will have the flexibility to work from home (attend office when required) and we will work with you on suitable shifts to complement your lifestyle (minimum of 19 hours per week). Shifts are negotiated across a 24/7 roster, based on the service requirements which is based around demand for support, your preferences, and the preferences of other team members. You will receive shift penalty rates based on the shifts occurring across the evening, overnight, weekend and public holidays.

About you:

You must be able to meet the following criteria:

  • A minimum three-year bachelor's qualification which meets the requirements of the Peak Body Registration.
  • Be eligible to register (or) hold current registration with one of the Professional Bodies at the required level: PACFA - Clinical, ACA - Lvl3 or above, Full - AASW or General Registration with AHPRA as a Psychologist.
  • At least two years full time counselling experience (Case Management not acceptable).
  • Demonstrated experience in brief, outcome-focused counselling (preferably telephone counselling) or equivalent experience in specialised domestic, family and sexual violence counselling, mental health services, crisis services, homelessness etc.
  • Demonstrated authentic, compassionate, empathetic responses in front line service delivery/ counselling role.
  • Experience working across telephone counselling/ intake/ assessment roles.
  • Capacity to work and support self and team in a complex and often demanding work environment.

Additional requirements:

  • Holder of a current working with children check/vulnerable people check relevant to your State, or proof of application prior to interview
  • A private room/space which can be used for your home office set up
  • Reliable internet connection
  • Strong computer skills (experience with using systems, MS Word, excel, outlook and internet)

At Telstra Health, we are passionate about creating an environment that's inclusive and supportive - a place where everyone can truly be themselves. We are committed to providing our people with a working environment that promotes and fosters positive health and wellness.

We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, workers of all ages, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTQIA+ across all locations across Australia to apply.

What’s next?

If this sounds like the role for you, then click on the apply button now. Our selection process involves:

  • Application review
  • Screening for shortlisted candidates
  • Detailed roster conversation with us
  • A 30-minute virtual interview with our Clinical team
  • Online assessments (Computer skills) and Pre-employment checks*

*Preferred candidates will be required to undertake pre-employment screening, including Tertiary Qualification and Professional Body Registration verification or evidence of eligibility where applicable, a National Police Check, Working with Children Check, reference checks and a right to work in Australia check.

If you would like more information about the position, please email us on recruitment@health.telstra.com using the subject line: 1800RESPECT Counsellors enquiry via EthicalJobs. Applications will be assessed and shortlisted as they are received so apply today!

We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.
448455.summary: Maximum term openings for First Response Counsellors who will provide telephone and online counselling as part of the national 1800RESPECT service. Morning, Afternoon and Evening shifts available.

448445.title: Trailwalker Campaign Assistant - Melbourne / Sydney
448445.description:
• Exceptional opportunity to join Oxfam Australia's signature high profile event team, Trailwalker.
  • 6 Months, Full-time, 25 to 35 (0.7 FTE to 1 FTE) hours per week, Open for job share
  • Melbourne or Sydney based

About Us

At Oxfam Australia, we believe all lives are equal and no-one should live in poverty. We are a member of Oxfam International, a global confederation working with partners and local communities in 87 countries.

Would you like to join this global movement of people working together to eliminate the inequalities that keep people in poverty?

Why you will love working at Oxfam

As part of Trailwalker team, you will use your skills, qualifications, lived experience and initiative to tackle inequality and flight poverty. Yes, you read that right, lived experience and initiative, because it is not all about key selection criteria.

Research shows that women will only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the selection criteria, while men will apply if they meet an average of 60%. We understand that life teaches us so much, so if you don't meet all the criteria but just know that you have what it takes, then please apply.

The Role

The Trailwalker Campaign Assistant is responsible for supporting the delivery of, in conjunction with internal stakeholders and outsourced suppliers, the annual Trailwalker campaign, ensuring that events are delivered with ‘supporter first’ principles, achieve revenue and operational goals, and positively and accurately reflect the work of Oxfam Australia.

This role is also responsible for administrative support to the Trailwalker Program Manager and Trailwalker Event and Projects Coordinator at the cessation of the program.

We can offer you

  • A base salary of $71,129 plus superannuation, superior leave benefits and access to generous non-for-profit salary packaging program (up to $18,450 of your salary tax-free).
  • The opportunity to use your talents and expertise to make a positive impact around the world.
  • We value flexibility and seek to support our people to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.
  • Cultural leave
  • Superannuation matching

Our culture is shaped by our values, which reinforce what we care about and how we do things, not just what we do. Our five core values of Accountability, Empowerment, Equality, Inclusiveness and Sustainability drive everything we do at Oxfam.

Oxfam is committed to preventing any type of unwanted behaviour at work including sexual harassment, exploitation and abuse, lack of integrity and financial misconduct. We are committed to promoting the welfare of children, young people and adults. Oxfam expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment through our code of conduct. We place a high priority on ensuring that only those who share and demonstrate our values are recruited to work for us. Therefore, our people are required to comply with the One Oxfam Child Safeguarding and Protection from Sexual Exploitation and Abuse policies and sign the Oxfam Australia Child Safeguarding and One Oxfam Employee Codes of Conduct.

How to Apply

Complete the online application form, then, as two separate documents, upload:

  1. a cover letter that tells us why you want to join Oxfam Australia, and how your professional history and lived experience makes you the right candidate.
  2. your CV.
  3. Please note that this role must be filled asap so we will be reviewing applications as they come in.

Here is the link to the Position Description.

Our people are at the heart of everything we do. We care deeply about creating a safe and inclusive workplace where our people feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunities and encourage applicants with personal experience of the forms of injustice we seek to address to apply for opportunities at Oxfam Australia.

Applicants will be required to show proof of their right to work in Australia with the subject to satisfactory clearance of a Police Records Check, and Counter Terrorism and Aid Diversion Check.

We give priority to protecting the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, supporters, and the communities we work with. If successful you may be required to provide evidence of your COVID-19 vaccination or approved medical contraindication prior to commencing employment with Oxfam Australia.
448445.summary: Exceptional opportunity to join Oxfam Australia's signature event team, Trailwalker. Work with external suppliers to review social media and supporter journey content plans. Melbourne or Sydney based.

448378.title: Social Worker
448378.description:
About the role

  • Provide a range of clinical and non-clinical psychosocial supports to assist individuals to support their mental health and achieve their recovery goals
  • Provide outreach support services which requires a willingness to work with participants in their homes and the community
  • Complete intake and assessment duties to ensure that the support response focuses on participant's strengths, goals and objectives
  • Assist with the development and implementation of shared support plans across the multi-disciplinary team
  • Use local knowledge and sector expertise to increase opportunities for people with severe mental health to be connected to the most appropriate supports
  • Co-facilitate therapeutic groups including DBT skills
  • Regularly monitor that the delivery of services and support are within the highest level of customer service using a trauma-informed and recovery orientated approach

Role criteria

  • Tertiary qualification in Social Work
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in supporting participants through the key responsibilities outlined in the position description - in particular, developing Recovery Plans to support participants in identifying and achieving their goals and undertaking comprehensive psychosocial assessments
  • Comprehensive understanding of the structural and systemic challenges people with severe and complex mental health experience
  • Strong understanding of supporting individuals who have experienced complex trauma
  • Well-developed practice framework that is grounded in trauma-informed, strengths based practice and the ability to articulate the key theories and models that underpin your practice
  • Understanding of group work and confidence to support the facilitation of psychological therapy and psychosocial support groups
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in computer skills, particularly data management systems, word processing skills and Microsoft Outlook management
  • Demonstrated ability to contribute as part of a team to provide a safe, equitable and rewarding workplace

Additional requirements

  • A current open QLD driver's licence and road worthy vehicle, insured to a minimum level covering third party property damage (comprehensive is recommended)
  • Working with Children card and Working with People with a Disability check or the ability to obtain one is mandatory

About Communify

Communify is committed to supporting people across all life stages and experiences to lead active, health and socially connected lives. we provide programs and services in areas of aged care, children, family and individual support, mental health, disability, housing & homelessness, drug & alcohol recovery and NDIS. through our Neighbourhood Centres and Community development Programs we also offer Emergency Relief, Social Inclusion activities, Food security, Multicultural Support, Community Gardens and Venue Hire.

Incentives include

  • Salary packaging providing tax benefits
  • Personalised Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Strong commitment to regular and meaningful supervision
  • Professional development budget and dedication to supporting the learning and growth of staff members
  • Diverse and inclusive values-based organisation that prides itself on being flexible and supportive

About the recovery and Discovery Centre

Communify’s Recovery and Discovery Centre is a Mental Health Hub that is designed to provide integrated, multi-disciplinary supports for people who live with severe and complex mental health concerns that are having a significant impact on daily life and wellbeing.

The Recovery and Discovery Centre is funded through the Brisbane North PHN and delivers support across three key funding streams: Individual and Group Psychosocial Support (including peer support), Clinical Care Navigation, and Individual and Group Psychological Therapies. With a framework based on the Recovery Model, the support that is provided is strengths-based, client-centred and trauma-informed.

How to Apply

Please apply on our careers website, via the Apply Now link, and by reading the position description (attached below) which outlines the Position Objective, Duties and Responsibilities and Selection Criteria.

Please include a resume and cover letter responding to the selection criteria.
448378.summary: PT/FT role supporting participants living with severe & complex mental health challenges to develop Recovery Plans & link with the professional & natural supports to live a full and meaningful life.

448283.title: Supported Independent Living (SIL) Manager
448283.description:
• Would you like to work with a NDIS registered provider experiencing significant growth within the industry?
  • Are you passionate about the disability space, and making an impact on people’s lives to help overcome their challenges?
  • Do you enjoy working as part of a team where your professional development, and upskilling is not overlooked, but encouraged?

Your next role

As a SIL Manager with 9D Care, you will provide operational leadership and management in the provision of all SIL services achieving inclusive outcomes for individuals and families accessing our disability service. The position primarily is also responsible for the recruitment of new SIL Participants and procuring new SIL properties and the ongoing relationship building within the NDIS sector and nurturing strong community ties.

The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of how SIL houses function and should also know how to set up a new SIL house from scratch.

About you

  • A natural leader with a positive attitude, professional conduct, and commitment to provide quality outcomes and service delivery for staff, individuals with a disability and the community
  • Have an understanding of legislative, contractual and internal policy, practice and reporting requirements in the NDIS sector
  • Are self-motivated, well organised, and resourceful and possess a high level of integrity, passion, and reliability.
  • Understand Behaviour Support Practice and its implementation.
  • Will possess a relevant qualification in Disability
  • Have a positive track record supporting people with complex behaviour including intellectual disabilities, complex health, and physical disabilities
  • Working knowledge of the NDIS and the SIL space.
  • A Min Certificate III in disability services, aged care or any relevant qualifications or bachelor’s in psychology, OT, or relevant health field.
  • Experience and skills to work competently alongside people, their family, and carers in their local community to build their capacity to participate in the community and manage some or all aspects of their plan.
  • Knowledge of the NDIS Operational Guidelines.
  • Experience in navigating NDIS systems.
  • An understanding of case management practices and principles.
  • Well-developed communication (both oral and written) skills with the capacity to prepare reports and correspondence.
  • Competence in the use of the latest computer software programs and is ability to enter, modify and extract data accurately, including the ability to track funding for NDIS plan.

Key Responsibilities

  • Maintain and build relationships with existing Participants and key referrers such as Support Coordinators, Plan Managers, Allied Health Professionals, Social Workers and Local Area Coordinators
  • Create new networks and relationships to onboard new SIL participants
  • Finding new SIL homes/properties and setting them up completely
  • Creating a Roster of Care (ROC) and sending quotes to the participant and their key stakeholders
  • Lead Behaviour Support Practice and implementation of plans at the SIL property
  • Creating Participant Support Plans as per the ROC and making sure that the key stakeholders are onboard with the support plans
  • Supervising support staff and services to provide positive support to Participants
  • Responsibility for the SIL Participants onboarding process
  • Supporting Participants, their families, and carers to understand and access the business’ services and policies
  • Attending Disability Expos, Forums, Open days, and Networking events to actively promote our SIL services

Essential criteria

  • Eligibility to work in Australia.
  • Working with vulnerable people card.
  • Double vaccination against covid 19. (Certificate required).
  • Working with Children Check.
  • NDIS workers screening check (Required)
  • Driver Licence (Required)
  • Minimum Certificate III in disability services, aged care or any relevant qualifications or bachelor’s in psychology, OT, or relevant health field.
448283.summary: SIL Manager role at 9D Care: Drive change, make a real impact on lives, and shape the future of disability support. Join our dynamic team and help us create inclusive communities!
448283.application: Please include your Resume as well as Cover Letter in the job application.

448267.title: Project Coordinator
448267.description:
The Australian Institute of Architects is the peak body for the architectural profession in Australia, representing more than 14,500 members across Australia and overseas. The Institute works to improve our built environment by promoting quality, responsible and sustainable design. When you join us, you’ll be supported by a proactive leadership team and a wide network of great peers from around the country.

So why the Australian Institute of Architects?

As an organisation, we are committed to providing a healthy, flexible, rewarding and inclusive environment. Driven by our culture and values, and steeped in history, the Australian Institute of Architects has been supporting the profession of architecture since 1930 and is committed to enabling and driving change and innovation internally, and for our members.

The successful candidate will be part of an altruistic and impactful community supported by inspiring leadership as well as a wider network of state-based peers.

Did we mention we support a Hybrid work model?

POSITION PURPOSE

The Project Coordinator assists in the delivery and administration of education projects and member services related to education and professional development as a key member of the National Education Team (NET), supporting the NET’s Lead and Officers.

ACCOUNTABILITIES

In accordance with Institute policies, procedures and guidelines and working in association with relevant staff, responsibilities will include:

  • Liaising with presenters and content producers in support of the delivery of CPD (Continuing Professional Development) and PALS (Practice Of Architecture Learning Series), including coordinating calendars, scheduling, and collating content according to production timelines
  • Managing the Institute’s event management, learning management and video conferencing platforms to ensure accurate, quality, and timely delivery of events and access to resources
  • Supporting members with issues relating to education, portal access, learning management and member database system issues
  • Supporting staff in their understanding and delivery of CPD, including maintaining the business unit’s SharePoint presence
  • Contributing to the continuous improvement of the National Education Team’s processes, products and services
  • Managing ad hoc administrative duties where required, including bookings, invoicing, payments etc

QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

The Project Coordinator should have the following:

  • Relevant tertiary qualification and/or demonstrated experience in project coordination and administrative duties, preferably in a peak body, membership association or education provider
  • Strong digital literacy with demonstrated experience using a range of digital platforms including databases, events management systems, online learning systems (ideally Moodle), web content management systems (ideally WordPress) and video editing software
  • Strong ability using Microsoft Office applications - Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, SharePoint

Careers that promote and celebrate excellence in architecture.

Have a question? Why not drop us an email to hr@architecture.com.au using the subject line: Project Coordinator enquiry via EthicalJobs, and we can also send you the PD.
448267.summary: This is a unique opportunity with the Australian Institute of Architects. Supporting the Education Project Lead and Officers in the delivery and administration of Education Projects.
448267.application: Applications should be addressed to Kate Concannon - Education Program Lead and consist of a covering letter (no longer than two pages) and a copy of your resume outlining your education and full career history.

448042.title: Accounts Officer
448042.description:
• Full-time (1.0 FTE), Permanent Position Available
  • Social, Community, Home Care & Disability Services Award Level 3

About Us:

We are a growing and innovative social enterprise supporting around 10,000 South Australians each year through housing and community services. Seeking opportunities to build positive pathways and connected thriving communities, we are one of few South Australian organisations offering an integrated model of housing and support. Together, we are committed to effecting long-term positive change for those we work with and the communities we work in.

Together, we are improving lives and building strong, resilient, and connected communities.

The Opportunity:

Are you a detail-driven professional with a passion for numbers who can provide high-level support for financial operations? If so, we're looking for a proactive Accounts Officer to join our Finance team.

In this role, you will be the cornerstone of our financial operations, managing Junction's daily payment cycle activities, and providing essential financial, administrative, and clerical support to ensure our services are delivered with precision and punctuality. You will be the go-to expert for tasks ranging from processing Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable invoices to reconciling credit card statements and processing petty cash reimbursements. Your attention to detail and ability to prioritise tasks will be instrumental in maintaining payment batch integrity.

If you are passionate about maintaining the financial integrity of an organisation and have a knack for prioritising tasks, this is the perfect opportunity for you. Join us and be a vital part of our financial success, enjoying a collaborative team atmosphere with ample opportunities for professional growth.

About You:

We are seeking a detailed orientated individual who:

  • Has demonstrated experience working in an accounts/finance role
  • Holds experience using Accounting Software packages
  • Can work professionally and maintain strict confidentiality
  • Possesses sound communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively both independently and as part of a team
  • Has a high level of attention to detail and accuracy
  • Has an advanced level of computer literacy including high proficiency using Microsoft Office Excel

What We Offer:

  • Values-driven culture
  • Generous salary sacrifice benefits
  • Great professional development opportunities
  • A You are Amazing Day – an extra day of paid leave to spend however you want
  • A NADIOC Day - an extra day of paid leave to attend NAIDOC celebrations
  • A supportive, flexible work environment with paid parental leave and a strong focus on staff wellbeing
  • Access to wholesale prices on selected products at Harvey Norman

You Will Need To:

  • Complete our online application process
  • Hold or be willing to obtain a General Probity Employment Screening
  • Hold or be willing to obtain a current Safe Environments Certificate
  • Undergo pre-employment testing as part of the recruitment process

How To Apply:

Click on the Apply Now button to be redirected to our recruitment site. Please ensure you complete all questions before submitting your application.

For further confidential inquiries contact Helen Haines, Executive Manager Finance on 0409 091 141.

Junction is an equal opportunity employer that embraces a culture of diversity. We encourage applications from the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities, people with disability, and people from every culture, gender and sexuality identity, age and ethnic background. Junction is committed to being a Child Safe organisation and has zero tolerance for child and family abuse.

A position description is attached.
448042.summary: Are you a passionate professional looking to join an organisation that is committed to effecting long-term positive change for South Australians?

447956.title: Head of Fundraising - Remote / Flexible Location
447956.description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a passionate environmentalist who wakes up in the morning wanting to make a big difference and gets excited about building a smaller organisation with heaps of growth potential. This leading role will drive the growth of a dynamic national environmental organisation tackling one a mega threat to nature – invasive species. You will be an all-rounder having had multiple successes in achieving growth targets in core fundraising programs including major and mid donors, regular giving, direct marketing appeals and digital.

You will implement the strategic three-year fundraising plan and have the skills to develop the new one in the following year. You will be surrounded by three of Australia’s best environment fundraisers (should you want it!). You and your team will be involved in a philanthropy specialist training program (should you also need it), as will your team to build a major gift powerhouse within the Council.

This role requires strong writing skills to develop fundraising materials, writing reports, analysing program success and preparing strategic and operational planning documents.

KEY FUNCTIONS

  • Leading the fundraising programs to year on year growth
  • Planning for and analysing and reporting on the performance of the fundraising programs
  • Writing fundraising and marketing communications
  • Managing a team to achieve fundraising results

This is a new position. We are hoping to hire ASAP so get your application in!

A position description is attached.
447956.summary: Invasive species are the leading cause of animal extinction and a major driver of environmental damage. Help to change that and see native species and our environment thrive in your lifetime.
447956.application:
This application process is in two stages.

  1. Attention your application to the Director of Marketing and Management. Submit your CV and LinkedIn profile via the form below. Should you be an appropriate applicant, you will be invited to write a letter of application.
  2. Write a letter of application addressing EACH of the key selection criteria listed in the job description attached.

Applicants that don’t reflect the key selection criteria in the letter of application will not be considered.

447940.title: Case Manager
447940.description:
• Specialist Family Violence Service - Crisis Accommodation and Case Management.
  • 0.8/0.9 EFT – some on call hours required (minimal).
  • Permanent ongoing role

GMI have recently transitioned from a communal model to newly developed Core and Cluster model (one of the recommendations from the Royal Commission into Family Violence), with new purpose-built facilities.

The role of the Case Manager is to provide family violence risk assessment, safety planning, advocacy and holistic case management support to victim/survivors (inc. children and young people) of family violence.

The successful applicant will have qualifications in Social Work or related discipline (Nursing, Midwifery, Mental Health, Counselling, Youth Work, Alcohol and Other Drugs, Public Health, Community Development or Psychology) and willing to engage in a professional development plan to meet the minimum qualifications for specialist family violence practitioner (further details in Position Description). They will practice from an intersectional feminist framework and recognise family violence as a gendered issue that impacts significantly on women and children/young people, whilst drawing from other relevant legislations and frameworks to ensure systemic, inclusive and strengths-based service delivery.

You will be rewarded with a positive work culture, Social, Community Housing and Disability Services Award conditions, EBA above award conditions, an organisational commitment to professional development and salary packaging options.

If you have any queries, please contact Leah Hoskin, Team Leader on 0421 754 272, or via email leah@gmi.org.au using the subject line: Case Manager enquiry via EthicalJobs.

GMI values and celebrates diversity. We strongly encourage women from culturally diverse, LGBTQI+, Mature Age or Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander backgrounds to apply.

Due to the nature of our service, we have an equal opportunity exemption and are unable to accept applicants from cis-men at this time.

A position description is attached.
447940.summary: Georgina Martina Inc. is a specialist family violence support service that provides crisis accommodation, support and case management to victim survivors of family violence.
447940.application:
Applications should include CV, Cover Letter and response to the Key Selection Criteria (KSC) and be submitted via the form below.

Applications without a response to the KSC will not be considered.

447945.title: Support Worker
447945.description:
• Specialist Family Violence Service - Crisis Accommodation and Case Management
  • Support Worker - Part Time, 37 hours per fortnight. Rotating roster of weekend day shifts and evenings shifts + sleepover
  • SCHADS level 4. Penalty rates apply in addition to salary packaging and above Award EBA conditions

The role of Support Worker involves a variety of tasks, including:

  • Provide crisis response and support service to victim/survivors of family violence
  • Welcoming clients into the service
  • Undertaking risk assessment and safety planning
  • Provide practical and emotional support to clients in the service
  • Liaising with internal and external stakeholders to ensure that the environment is friendly, culturally inclusive and client focussed.
  • Leading play with children and initiating creative activities for women to engage with their children.
  • De-escalating behaviours and supporting women and children with their daily routines, as required
  • Setting up and preparing units for new clients to enter refuge

The successful incumbents requires a great deal of autonomy, initiative, and problem-solving skills being the sole staff member onsite during most shifts. OnCall back up support provided.

If you have any queries, please contact Laura Sherry, Team Leader on 0410 628 360, or via email laura@gmi.org.au using the subject line: Support Worker enquiry via EthicalJobs.

GMI values and celebrates diversity. We strongly encourage women from culturally diverse, LGBTQI+, Mature Age or Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander backgrounds to apply.

Due to the nature of our service, we have an equal opportunity exemption and are unable to accept applicants from cis-men at this time.

A position description is attached.
447945.summary: Georgina Martina Inc. are seeking Support Workers to support victim/survivors of family violence during their stay in refuge. Seeking applicants with availability to cover weekend and evening shifts.
447945.application: Application should include CV, Cover Letter and response to the Key Selection Criteria.

447944.title: Senior Practitioner
447944.description:
• 9 days per fortnight (0.9 FTE)
  • Ongoing position
  • North West Melbourne location - site based role
  • SCHADS level 6.1 + Salary Packaging options and above Award EBA conditions
  • Some OnCall hours required
  • Extensive learning and development opportunities

Georgina Martina Inc. is a community-based organisation which operates a state-wide family violence support and accommodation service including two high security ‘Core and Cluster’ refuges – Georgina and Martina. The organisation is committed to an intersectional feminist and strength-based approach to service delivery that views victim/survivors as the experts in their own lives. Our practice framework is multi-disciplinary, child focused, and trauma informed.

GMI are seeking an experienced Family Violence Practitioner to support the Team Leader in mentoring and developing a consistent approach to practice within the organisation and contribute to the development of practice tools and procedures in line with relevant frameworks, legislation and evidence.

If you have any questions or would like to discuss the role further, please contact Laura Sherry, Team Leader on 0410 628 360 or laura@gmi.org.au, using the subject line: Senior Practitioner enquiry via EthicalJobs

GMI values and celebrates diversity. We strongly encourage women from culturally diverse, LGBTQI+, Mature Age or Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander backgrounds to apply.

Due to the nature of our service, we have an equal opportunity exemption and are unable to accept applicants from cis-men at this time.

A position description is attached.
447944.summary: Seeking an experienced Family Violence Practitioner who can mentor, support and develop staff practice, as well as contribute to the review and implementation of practice policies and procedures.
447944.application:
Applications should include CV, Cover Letter and response to the Key Selection Criteria (KSC) and be submitted via the form below.

Applications without a response to the KSC will not be considered.

447875.title: Child Development Assistant
447875.description:
54 reasons' Mobile Play2Learn is an outreach early childhood program that goes out into the community and supports families and children to reach their full potential. In this rewarding work environment, we need you to assist in the delivery of quality early childhood education and promote parent-child interaction. Working casually, you'll be flexible to work when required, giving you a great work/life balance.

54 reasons is Australia's leading child rights organisation - no ordinary not-for-profit

Proudly part of the Save the Children Australia Group and global movement, we're here to make sure that everyone understands their rights. So that children and young people have their rights met and thrive, in all their diversity.
We champion the children, young people and families we work with. We are inspired by the curiosity and creativity of children and motivated by the love of those who care for them.

With the child's voice at the centre, we provide quality services to children and their caregivers, advocating with them so that children develop, learn, and are connected, safe and confident. Our people are proudly local, reflective of the communities we serve - in every state and territory, and across regions, remote areas and capital cities.

Where you come in

In this casual position working across Brisbane, you'll support early childhood development and school readiness skills, and will facilitate improved relationships between parents and children. Working across different sites as part of our mobile service, you'll work in a team to create an environment of trust and respect with families and children.

You'll be part of our Mobile Play2Learn team and report to our Team Leader.

You will make an impact by:

  • Assisting to develop and deliver early learning programs
  • Working within a team to ensure programs are age and developmentally appropriate
  • Creating a welcoming and safe environment to encourage active participation
  • Growing an understanding of early learning amongst families and sharing your knowledge with community members

Does this sound like you?

You're passionate about working with young children and parents and making a difference in their lives. Your sensitivity and community knowledge will see you build strong connections with families from varying cultural and socio-economic backgrounds. You're motivated, eager to learn and not afraid to jump in feet first to help make our programs successful.

This role requires:

  • Minimum Certificate III in Children's Services or equivalent qualification
  • Experience working with children 0-5 and families in a group setting
  • Strong organisational and time management skills
  • Current valid driver's licence

Working at 54 reasons is more than just a job

We are a learning organisation that invests in the development and wellbeing of our people. Our workforce is 680+ people strong, and proudly diverse, whether in race, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexuality, cultures and beliefs.

We are creative, connected and accountable, bringing energy, guts and ideas to all we do to champion children in Australia and partner with families, communities and partners to bring about change.

Our people work from both home and office, with important moments held in-person to foster belonging and support professional development.

Other benefits include:

  • Casual award rate salary (SCHADS Level 2.1 - $40.26 per hour)
  • Friendly and flexible work environment
  • Internal deployment and secondment opportunities

For more information regarding the employee benefits of the Save the Children Australia group, please follow this link.

Sound interesting?

We'd love to hear from you. Submit your cover letter and resume by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

Position Description - Child Development Assistant

For more information regarding the program click here or feel free to contact Dean Wrobel - Team Leader on 0411 668 852 or dean.wrobel@54reasons.org.au using the subject line: Child Development Assistant enquiry via EthicalJobs.

We have tested our application process with diverse groups in mind, with the intent to ensure it's straightforward and accessible for all to apply. Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our culture and improve our ability to reach our most vulnerable client groups. But we also know there is no one-size fits-all when it comes to recruitment - so if we didn't quite hit the mark for you, please let us know! We're dedicated to ensuring54 reasons is a workplace suitable for all people and can modify our processes to suit you - no matter your race, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexuality, neurodiversity, culture and beliefs.

54 reasons is a child-safe organisation. All employees are required to undergo a National Police Check, a Working with Children Check where necessary, and sign our Child Safeguarding Policy and Code of Conduct. We also support the Inter-Agency Misconduct Disclosure Scheme. You can read about the Scheme and our commitment to Safeguarding here.
447875.summary: Join us and make a difference in your local community! Bring your skill sets & experience to help children and families across Brisbane.

447793.title: Support Coordinator - Tweed Heads
447793.description:
Are you passionate about making a positive impact on people's lives? Do you have exceptional organisational and communication skills? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Support Coordinator in the Way Back Service at New Horizons!

About Us:

At New Horizons, we are committed to providing compassionate and comprehensive support to individuals facing challenging times in their lives. The Way Back Service focuses on assisting individuals who have attempted suicide or experienced a suicidal crisis by offering immediate support and ensuring a smooth transition back into their community.

What we’re offering

  • Salary packaging of up to $15,900+ in tax free pay
  • Monthly RDO's
  • Access to flexible work arrangements and purchased annual leave program.
  • Reward program that recognises your achievements
  • Utilise our Employee Assistance Program providing counselling services.
  • Support in growing your career through mentoring and professional development opportunities.
  • Free onsite parking

Job Overview: Support Coordinator - Way Back Service

As a Support Coordinator in the Way Back Service, you will play a crucial role in providing essential support to individuals in crisis. You will be responsible for coordinating services and resources to ensure a seamless journey for customers during their transition from crisis to stability. Your empathetic nature, excellent communication skills, and ability to collaborate with various stakeholders will contribute to the success of our mission to prevent suicide and support mental wellness.

We are on the lookout for a compassionate and driven Support Coordinator to join our Way Back Service and provide support in the Far North Coast on a max term full time basis until 28th June 2024.

Reporting to the Clinical Team Leader based in Tweed Heads, the positions will be instrumental in providing individualised, recovery-focussed and practical support to our customers, in the first 3 months following a suicide attempt.

The position can be based in Tweed or Lismore. Working days and hours are fromMonday to Friday 8.00 AM to 4.30 PM.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Mental Health or Social Services related fields
  • Valid NSW Drivers C class licence, with ability to drive vehicles in licence class, including large cars & vans
  • Preparedness to travel to betweenTweed Head andsurrounding areas
  • Checks required to work in the Not for Profit sector: National Police Check, NDIS Worker Check, Working with Children Check, Covid Vaccination. Having these checks in place will speed up your application but do not preclude you from applying.

Interested? Apply online today.

New Horizons values diversity and encourages applications from all people. Our vision is to see happy inclusive communities work together in collaborative and inclusive ways to create opportunity and improve quality of life. Our workforce proudly reflects the local communities we connect with and support.
447793.summary: As a Support Coordinator in the Way Back Service, you will support individuals during their transition from crisis to stability.

447750.title: Finance Manager
447750.description:
LiverWELL, incorporating Hepatitis Victoria, champions the interests of people affected by or at risk of viral hepatitis and liver disease. We are working to eliminate viral hepatitis by 2030 and to improve liver health for all Australians. We do this by providing information, support, referrals, and education, as well as advocating for people living with liver disease and providing training for those who work with them.

LiverWELL is currently seeking a Finance Manager in a permanent part time role of 3 days per week. You will be part of a small, passionate team and play a key role providing financial, budget and accounting support. Reporting to the CEO, you will be an integral member of the LiverWELL management team.

You will provide strategic financial advice and planning as well as managing accurate and timely financial reporting, analysis, and commentary, ensure robust financial controls and the implementation of process improvements. You will also manage the accounting, budget and outsourced payroll processes.

As well as your financial management expertise and experience you will bring strong interpersonal leadership and communication skills and enjoy working with a range of stakeholders including the suppliers, funders, our Board, and all levels of staff.

LiverWELL is committed to employing Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, persons with lived experience of viral hepatitis and liver disease, and those who come from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. People from these communities are encouraged to apply.

LiverWELL offers an enjoyable and flexible team working environment in North Melbourne, ongoing professional development and excellent conditions including salary packaging options and benefits.

Applications must address the key selection criteria contained in the Position Description attached below.

Apply as soon as possible to be considered for an interview.

Enquiries: admin@liverwell.org.au using the subject line: Finance Manager enquiry via EthicalJobs.
447750.summary: Be part of a small, passionate team and play a key role providing financial, budget and accounting support. Reporting to the CEO, you will be an integral member of the LiverWELL management team.

447775.title: Direct Marketing and Digital Fundraising Manager - Growth - Flexible Location
447775.description:
• Join one of the world's largest and most respected conservation organisations
  • Workplace flexibility including monthly Rostered Day Off
  • 9-month Maternity leave cover
  • Location Flexibility (Australia)

About the organisation

For over 60 years WWF has been a powerful voice for nature and communities. We are a global network of local organisations working in 100 countries.WWF-Australia is the largest Southern Hemisphere member of the WWF Network with over 2.5 million supporters.

We work as a catalyst with communities, First Nations, governments, businesses, innovators, and philanthropists towards our global mission: to build a world where people live and prosper in harmony with nature. We use our superpowers to conserve biodiversity, empower communities and halt climate change in Australia and throughout the Asia Pacific region.

As part of WWF Australia, you will be part of a diverse global team of over 7000 employees - working together in a values driven global to local network for the prosperity of both people and our planet.

Click here to learn more about our 60 year history.

About the role

The Direct Marketing and Digital Fundraising Manager drives growth through the development and implementation of Regular Giving and Single Gift fundraising activities. This role manages the approach to supporter growth and conversion, including the coordination of large-scale acquisition campaigns. This role seeks to drive a positive and engaging experience across the individual supporter lifecycle; with the aim of growing revenue and increasing supporters’ lifetime value in alignment with WWF’s conservation goals.

Key accountabilities (please refer to PD for full list)

  • Collaborates to develop and implement WWF-Australia’s Regular Giving and Single Gift fundraising programs, to increase income from existing and prospective individual supporters.
  • Manages, coaches and motivates a direct report to achieve shared income and growth targets.
  • Manages multi-channel acquisition across digital, TV, telemarketing, e-commerce, and new acquisition channels, delivering results to budgeted acquisition and retention targets.
  • Supports donor retention and renewal activities and implements digital strategies to achieve shared budgets and goals.
  • Coordinates external agency management, ensuring compliance with relevant legislation and industry Codes, achievement of performance targets, training and engagement of agency team members.
  • Collaborates to align activities with supporter lifecycles and the next best action.
  • Leverages WWF’s innovation methodologies and collaborates across the organisation to drive new fundraising product development, plus ensures a strong test-and-learn approach is implemented across fundraising and engagement activities.

Skills, knowledge and experience(please refer to PD for full list)

  • Demonstrated experience managing digital, traditional and omni-channel fundraising acquisition and growth campaigns.
  • Demonstrated experience in managing and developing a direct report(s).
  • Demonstrated experience in managing budgets and achieving income targets.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of best practice supporter-centric principles.
  • Demonstrated project management skills and experience.
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
  • High organisational skills and ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a flexible team-based environment.
  • Competency in utilising CRMs (ideally Blackbaud The Raisers Edge) and Microsoft Excel.

The ideal candidate will have an ability to work both autonomously and constructively within a team and be aligned with WWF's vision, mission and I-CCaRe Values - Integrity, Courage, Collaboration and Respect.

WWF values diversity and is building a workforce that reflects the community we serve. WWF is an equal opportunity employer and Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from culturally & linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds, sexuality and gender diverse (LGBTQIA+) community members, and people living with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

WWF-Australia staff work in teams and in regional and remote communities. To protect the health and safety of WWF-Australia team members and people in regional and remote communities, WWF-Australia requires all persons who apply for employment at WWF-Australia after 25 October 2021 to provide evidence that they have received the first and second courses of an Australian government-recognised COVID-19 vaccination before a job offer can be made.

Applications

Applicants can apply viaclicking Apply Now below. Only those applicants applying online via the eRecruitment System will be considered.

Please include the following two attachments: (1) a cover letter/statements against the selection criteria and (2) your resume (CV).

Note that applicants require current unlimited working rights in Australia to be eligible for this role.

A Position Description is attached.
447775.summary: We are creating a world where people live in harmony with nature. Join us in this maternity leave cover position. Because together, anything is possible.

447723.title: Head of Program - Sydney / Melbourne
447723.description:
Our Team

In the face of rising levels of unmet legal need, Justice Connect designs and delivers high impact interventions to increase access to legal support and progress social justice.

The Access Program is of central importance to people who need legal help and who often have nowhere else to turn. This team provides services to people who turn up to court alone, those who have experienced disasters, and people who have a range of financial and employment legal issues.

Through our work we provide information, advice, and pro bono referrals. We use a range of different tools to deliver help, including outreach to courts, legal service clinics and cutting-edge digital systems that leverage the pro bono assistance offered by leading Australian law firms.

The Access Program strategy is aligned to Justice Connect’s strategy and aims to scale services to reach more people, to strengthen our capacity to respond to emerging legal issues, and to carry out strategic work to address the drivers of unmet legal need and system-level issues.

Our ideal candidate

You'll bring to the team experience in the following areas:

  • Working in a senior leadership role and leading teams to deliver high impact services and projects.
  • Experience in the social justice sector and ideally in relation to service delivery.
  • Engaging in high-level critical analysis of a wide range of complex information to understand and improve impact and performance.
  • Tackling important strategic, service, team, and policy issues and developing effective responses to address these issues.
  • Communicating effectively and building an engaged and positive team culture.

Candidates will need to demonstrate:

  • Commitment to Justice Connect's vision, strategy and values including a commitment to social justice.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to successfully build and manage strategic relationships with a broad range of stakeholders.
  • Strong leadership skills including the ability to diagnose, tackle, and resolve critical issues through analysis and collaboration.
  • Strong ability to provide management, coaching, and support of staff.
  • Ability to strategically plan and prioritise, including the ability to meet accountability and reporting requirements.
  • Agility and comfort during change. Ability to stay focused and calm under pressure, and appropriately prioritise competing demands.

This role is for someone with a track record of leading a high-performance culture and who is committed to the delivery of impact for people with legal needs.

What you will achieve in the role

These are only a few of the areas of focus for the role.

  • Work with the Organisational Leadership Team (OLT) on the implementation of the Justice Connect strategy and strategic directions.
  • Lead the implementation of the Access Program strategy. Work with the team to deliver increased impact through individual service delivery, digital strategies to help more people, and broader systemic engagement to tackle structural issues undermining access to justice.
  • Lead, coach, and support the Access Program leadership team.
  • Use data (including stories) as the basis of taking action. This includes understanding key service and systemic issues and challenges, developing new solutions, engaging with key stakeholders (internal and external), and communicating clearly about team impact and effectiveness.
  • Support the coordination of pro bono partnerships across Justice Connect including ongoing implementation of our membership model and engagement strategy.

A week in this role

If you were here last week, you would have:

  • Met and engaged with a range of important program stakeholders and key partners including funders, Courts, referring services (including Community Legal Centres), and member law firms.
  • Tackled strategic issues and decision making in relation to a broad range of issues as part of the Justice Connect executive team.
  • Led advocacy in areas where the Program has legal expertise – in particular, financial rights, employment law, and disaster response.
  • Met with and provided coaching and support to direct reports. Assessed implementation of the Access Program strategy, discussed operations and addressed a challenging client issue.
  • Collated, reviewed, and reflected on data to understand program impact and strategy implementation. Met with the CEO and COO to discuss.
  • Reviewed, managed, and identified funding opportunities as well as ensured compliance with reporting requirements for funders.
  • Worked with the Justice Connect CFO to review and manage the Access Program Budget and Forecast.

What we offer

We believe in creating an environment where people will thrive.

If you want your next role to have purpose, support you to master new skills and build meaningful relationships then Justice Connect is the place to work.

We offer a range of benefits including:

  • Progressive leave entitlements
  • Flexible working arrangements with a minimum of 40% in the workplace attendance across the month
  • Access to EAP
  • New hire and ongoing learning and development

Important role information

The position reports to the CEO.

Employment is full-time ongoing. Consideration will be made for those looking for a part-time opportunity of 30 hours a week (0.8 FTE).

The salary for this role is $135,418.42 per annum (pro rata) (plus 11% superannuation) with annual leave loading and generous salary packaging options.

This role can be based at either our Melbourne or Sydney CBD offices with 40% of the month in the workplace with hybrid working arrangements.

How to Apply

Please upload your resume and a cover letter which outlines your skills and experience that will help you achieve success in this role, via the Apply Now link.

For further information contact Nathalie Chasen, People and Culture Manager, 03 8593 4797.

Please note: applications will be reviewed as they are received and interviews may be scheduled before the close date.
447723.summary: You will lead a team that aims to scale services, strengthen capacity to respond to legal issues, and carry out strategic work to address the drivers of unmet legal needs and system-level issues.
